answers.answer: Hi there!Though x-rays could be responsible for erectile dysfunction/ impotency, this usually happens over long term after continuous exposure to radiation and a couple of x-rays are unlikely to be responsible in such a situation. One may consider looking at other causes such as psychological stress, performance anxiety, depression, neurogenic disorders peyronie's disease, body image issues, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hormonal imbalance, radiation therapy, kidney failure, metabolic disorders, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc.Hope this information is helpful.Take care!

question: Can a couple of X Ray scanning of lumbar spine cause impotency in male??
title: Can X-Ray cause impotency?
